com.mygdx.game

Class Projectile

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mygdx.game.Projectile

  • public class Projectile
extends java.lang.Object
    Projectile class creates its own body and calculates its velocity relative to the cursor click and the Player's position. After a certain time it will signify that it is ready for deletion, however it cannot delete itself and so must pass this information back up to the GameEngine so that it can delete it.
    Author:
    Sean Aubrey, Gabriel Fountain, Brandon Conn

    • Constructor Detail

      • Projectile

        public Projectile(float playerX,
                  float playerY,
                  float mouseX,
                  float mouseY)
        Constructor that assigns passed values locally that will be used to calculate trajectory. Creates graphical and physical body objects.
        Parameters:
        playerX - player's X coordinate in pixels.
        playerY - player's Y coordinate in pixels.
        mouseX - cursor's X coordinate in pixels.
        mouseY - cursor's Y coordinate in pixels.

    • Method Detail

      • calculateVelocity

        private void calculateVelocity()
        Takes the differences in X and Y between the cursor click location and the player to calculate how much X and Y velocities should be used with respect to the Projectile's maximum velocity in order to angle the trajectory accurately. Formula to determine X + Y velocities: BF(n) = B(n/(n+1)) + B(1/(n+1)), where n is X/Y slope and B is max velocity.

      • determineQuadrant

        private com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 determineQuadrant()
        Determines which corner of the player to spawn the projectile to avoid intersecting with the player.
        Returns:
        vector signifying quadrant of player.

      • simulateResistance

        public void simulateResistance()
        Applies acceleration against the velocity of the projectile to slow it down.

      • setPos

        public void setPos()
        Sets graphical object's position to a physical body's position.

      • deletable

        public boolean deletable(float time)
        Accumulates time until the despawn time is reached.
        Parameters:
        time - difference in time between frames.
        Returns:
        true if projectile is deletable.

      • getBody

        public com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Body getBody()
        Returns physical body.
        Returns:
        projectile's physical body.

      • scale

        public float scale(float val)
        Scales pixel dimensions to the camera's viewport size so that physical object dimensions can be declared in units of meters to function correctly within Box2D. In other words, rather than scaling the objects to the window size, we scale the window size to the object.
        Parameters:
        val - window dimension
        Returns:
        viewport dimension
